Main Claim.text: We may appreciate and engage with works that lack a human creator; these works have aesthetic value

Implied author.text: Aesthetic consumers mentally create an ""implied author""

Engagement and social consensus trumps '.text: How people engage with art is more important than trying to ""define the essence of true authorship nor to construct a theory of an 'artificial author'.""

relations.src: Engagement and social consensus trumps 'actual' authorship
